hero.headline: Claude Code Hits $1B Revenue in 6 Months, Now Coming to Slack for Full AI Workflow Automation
hero.summary: Anthropic's Claude Code has reached a staggering $1 billion in run-rate revenue just six months after its May 2025 public launch. Now the company is bringing Claude Code directly into Slack, allowing developers to delegate coding tasks from chat threads with automatic repository analysis, progress updates, and PR creation.
hero.whyItMatters: Claude Code in Slack transforms the 32-million-user platform into an AI-powered development environment. Developers can tag @Claude in a bug report thread, and it will spin up a complete coding session, analyze context from recent messages, work in the right repository, and share links to review changes. This isn't just another chatbot—it's enterprise-grade agentic coding embedded where teams already collaborate.

topStories.title: OpenAI Releases GPT-5.2: Latest Frontier Model with Improved Knowledge, Reasoning, and Coding
topStories.summary: OpenAI announced GPT-5.2 with significant improvements across knowledge, reasoning, and coding capabilities. Codex CLI 0.71.0 immediately integrates the new model, making it the default for agentic coding workflows with enhanced model picker functionality.

topStories.title: byLLM Framework: Add AI to Software with One Line of Code—No Prompt Engineering Required
topStories.summary: The new open-source byLLM framework eliminates manual prompt engineering by enabling seamless LLM integration with a single line of code. In evaluations, byLLM achieved higher accuracy and better runtime performance than DSPy, with developers completing tasks 3x faster using 45% fewer lines of code.

topStories.title: Context Engineering is the New Prompt Engineering: Designing Environments Where AI Can Think
topStories.summary: The industry is shifting from prompt engineering to context engineering—designing environments where AI can think with depth, consistency, and purpose. It's no longer about clever wording but about providing the right information architecture for AI reasoning.

topStories.title: Anthropic Engineers Report 50% Productivity Gains with Claude in 60% of Their Work
topStories.summary: A new study of 132 Anthropic engineers reveals that staff now use Claude in approximately 60% of their work, self-reporting productivity gains of about 50%. Claude Code is increasingly being trusted to handle complex workflows with less human steering.

trendingRepos.name: thedotmack/claude-mem
trendingRepos.description: Claude Code plugin that automatically captures session activity, compresses it with AI using Claude's agent-sdk, and injects relevant context back into future sessions. Gained 1,669 stars today.

trendingRepos.name: agentsmd/agents.md
trendingRepos.description: AGENTS.md—a simple, open format for guiding coding agents. Donated by OpenAI to the Agentic AI Foundation as the standard for instructing AI agents about repository conventions.

trendingRepos.name: block/goose
trendingRepos.description: An open source, extensible AI agent that goes beyond code suggestions—install, execute, edit, and test with any LLM. Built in Rust for performance with multi-provider support.

trendingRepos.name: Tencent/WeKnora
trendingRepos.description: LLM-powered framework for deep document understanding, semantic retrieval, and context-aware answers using the RAG paradigm. From Tencent's research labs.

trendingSkills.name: multi-ai-code-review
trendingSkills.description: Multi-AI code review orchestration using Codex, Gemini, and Claude with automatic fallback. Coordinates simultaneous evaluations from multiple AI models for comprehensive code analysis.

trendingSkills.name: google-adk
trendingSkills.description: Build agentic systems leveraging Google ADK in Python. Enables development of autonomous AI agents and multi-agent architectures for sophisticated workflows.

trendingSkills.name: doc-flow
trendingSkills.description: AI-Driven Specification-Driven Development (SDD) workflow orchestrator that guides skill selection and methodology for structured AI-powered development processes.

trendingSkills.name: local-rag
trendingSkills.description: Index local folders and semantically search documents using RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation). Supports multiple formats with persistent vector storage via ChromaDB.

newMcpServers.name: arxiv-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Comprehensive bridge between AI assistants and arXiv's research repository. Search papers with advanced filtering, download and store papers locally as markdown, and conduct deep research analysis.

newMcpServers.name: sqlite-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Transforms SQLite into an AI-ready database engine with advanced analytics, text and vector search, geospatial capabilities, and intelligent workflow automation.

newMcpServers.name: apify-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Access the world's largest marketplace of tools for web scraping, data extraction, and web automation. Extract structured data from social media, e-commerce, search engines, and more.

newMcpServers.name: rust-mcp-filesystem
newMcpServers.description: High-performance, async filesystem MCP server built in Rust. Token-efficient operations allow LLMs to precisely target searches and edits within specific sections of large files.

notableHooks.name: Hooks Mastery Collection
notableHooks.description: Comprehensive hook examples from disler/claude-code-hooks-mastery covering dangerous command blocking, auto-formatting, logging, and workflow automation patterns.

notableHooks.name: Desktop Notification on Stop
notableHooks.description: Sends desktop notification when Claude finishes a session. Perfect for long-running operations where you've switched contexts—get alerted when Claude needs your attention.

notableHooks.name: GitButler Auto-Commit
notableHooks.description: GitButler's hook configuration automatically manages commits after file changes. Matches Edit|MultiEdit|Write patterns to track changes with a Stop hook ensuring all work is committed.

tuiTools.name: lazygit
tuiTools.description: Simple terminal UI for git commands. The original 'lazy' TUI that started a movement—navigate branches, stage changes, and manage commits with vim-like efficiency.

tuiTools.name: gitui
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal-ui for git written in Rust. Lightweight alternative to lazygit with async operations and minimal resource footprint.

tuiTools.name: posting
tuiTools.description: A powerful HTTP client that lives in your terminal. Built with Textual for testing APIs without leaving the command line—beautiful and productive.

tuiTools.name: rainfrog
tuiTools.description: Database management TUI supporting Postgres, MySQL, and SQLite. Query, browse, and manage databases with a beautiful ratatui-powered interface.

trendingVideos.title: Anthropic just bought your favorite JS runtime...
i think this is what AI should look like
How I Code with AI Right Now
Stop Switching Between Cursor and JetBrains - AI Coding Native in IDEA

highlights: Switch models while writing prompts with alt+p (Linux/Windows) or option+p (macOS)
Context window information now shown in status line input
New fileSuggestion setting for custom @ file search commands
System instruction updates for Gemini 3.0 compatibility
Auto-execute simple slash commands on Enter
Built-in holiday theme for festive terminal vibes
GPT-5.2 integration: 'our latest frontier model with improvements across knowledge, reasoning and coding'
Shell snapshotting capabilities for better session recovery

notableQuotes.quote: Claude Code in Slack allows developers to tag @Claude to spin up a complete coding session using Slack context. Claude analyzes recent messages to determine the right repository, posts progress updates in threads, and shares links to review work and open pull requests.
notableQuotes.author: Anthropic

notableQuotes.quote: Context engineering is replacing prompt engineering as the new frontier of control. It's not about clever wording anymore—it's about designing environments where AI can think with depth, consistency, and purpose.
notableQuotes.author: KDnuggets

notableQuotes.quote: A study of 132 Anthropic engineers found that staff now use Claude in around 60% of their work, self-reporting productivity gains of about 50%, and that Claude Code is increasingly being trusted to handle complex workflows with less human steering.
notableQuotes.author: Anthropic Internal Study

prompt: Daily AI news digest for December 11, 2025. Hero: Claude Code hits $1B revenue milestone in 6 months, now coming to Slack for full AI workflow automation—developers can tag @Claude to spin up complete coding sessions from chat threads. Top stories: GPT-5.2 released with improved reasoning and coding, byLLM framework eliminates manual prompt engineering, context engineering replacing prompt engineering, Anthropic engineers report 50% productivity gains. Fresh trending repos: claude-mem (1669 stars today), agents.md, block/goose, Tencent/WeKnora. New skills from SkillsMP: multi-ai-code-review, google-adk, doc-flow, local-rag. MCP servers: arxiv, sqlite, apify, rust-mcp-filesystem. Notable hooks: Hooks Mastery collection, desktop notifications, GitButler auto-commit. TUI tools: lazygit, gitui, posting, rainfrog. Tool updates: Claude Code 2.0.65, Gemini CLI 0.20.0, Codex 0.71.0 with GPT-5.2.
